text: Orlando Cole (August 16, 1908 â€“ January 25, 2010) was a cello teacher who had taught soloists and first cellists in a dozen leading orchestras. Among them are Lynn Harrell, David Cole, Ron Leonard, Owen Carman, Daniel Lee, Lorne Munroe, and Marcie Rosen.Conversation with Orlando Cole He had held master- classes all over the world and continued his seventy-five year teaching career at the Curtis Institute and Temple University with his assistant Metta Watts. ==References== Category:American cellists Category:1908 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American teachers Category:Educators from Pennsylvania Category:20th-century musicians
title: Orlando Cole
